description.S1: Ludwig revealed that he's tucked away a secret weapon in Edgewater,
description.S2: to be used in the event of a mechanical uprising.
description.S3: He's decided to entrust the weapon to you to aid in the crusade.
description.S4: The weapon should be in the bathroom of Edgewater's cantina.

blurb.B1: Go to the canteen and look behind the toilet,
blurb.B2: you can pick up Ludwig's Sealed Bundle.

description.S1: You found the weapon that Ludwig had stashed in Edgewater.
description.S2: Return to him and learn how he intends to use it against the mechanical menace.

blurb.B2: return it to Ludwig to receive a Mag-2-Zap as a reward.
blurb.B3: Ludwig then asks the Stranger to retrieve an undamaged logic module in the geothermal power plant.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I found that package you mentioned.

dialog.speaker: LudwigMiller (Male)
dialog.utterance: Feast your eyes, soldier. This here's a genuine Spacer's Choice Injury Customizing Unit, designed to deliver a lethal blast of electrical discharge. I call it the Hand of the Law.

dialog.speaker: LudwigMiller (Male)
dialog.utterance: You ever wanna see a mechanical flailing around like a grounded fish, you stick a couple thousand volts in its guts, with compliments from old Ludwig.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: How do I use this "Injury Customizing Unit," exactly?

dialog.speaker: LudwigMiller (Male)
dialog.utterance: Fun? This ain't some quarterly performance review, soldier. Ours is a grave and sacred duty.

dialog.speaker: LudwigMiller (Male)
dialog.utterance: Time's come for you to journey down into the black heart of the enemy's camp. I'm talking about the old geothermal plant.

dialog.speaker: LudwigMiller (Male)
dialog.utterance: Unfortunately, the old plant lies outside my Board-given jurisdiction. You'll need to get a passcode from the boss, Reed Tobson.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I feel like I'm going to regret getting mixed up in this.

dialog.speaker: LudwigMiller (Male)
dialog.utterance: I need you to get us the brain of a mechanical. Well, not exactly a brain. Anatomically speaking, what we're looking for is a logic module.

dialog.speaker: LudwigMiller (Male)
dialog.utterance: If you die horribly, I will pour out a can of Zero Gee to your memory.

dialog.speaker: LudwigMiller (Male)
dialog.utterance: Don't tell anyone, all right? I've got a contact. A real expert in the inner workings of the automaton. We are gonna rip those mechanicals' secrets right out of their circuits.

dialog.speaker: LudwigMiller (Male)
dialog.utterance: There's a workbench right through this door. Attach that unit to your favorite weapon, and go forth into glorious battle.
